slides.title: ROI Tracking

content.headline: Know What's Actually Making You Money
content.subhead: Set up ROI tracking in 15 minutes

slides.narration: Half your marketing works. The problem is knowing which half. ROI tracking shows you exactly what's generating revenue so you can double down on winners and cut losers. Let's set it up.

slides.title: What You'll Track
slides.narration: We'll set up attribution to know where customers come from, track your costs across channels, connect revenue back to marketing sources, and calculate ROI so you know what's actually profitable.

slides.title: Step 1: Attribution Setup

attribution_methods: Ask 'How did you hear about us?'

slides.narration: Set up attribution—knowing where customers come from. Use UTM parameters on all marketing links. Add 'How did you hear about us?' to your forms. Use unique phone numbers for different channels. Track which landing pages convert. Use specific coupon codes by source. Every touchpoint needs tracking or you're guessing.

slides.title: Step 2: Track Costs
slides.narration: Track all your costs. Advertising spend broken down by platform. Software and tool subscriptions. Time invested—assign your hourly value. Content creation costs. Agency or contractor fees. Track monthly by channel so you can compare costs to results for each.

slides.title: Step 3: Connect Revenue

connection_methods: Track customer lifetime value by source
Connect invoices to original lead source
Attribute repeat purchases to original channel
content.insight: Some channels have higher LTV than others

slides.narration: Connect revenue back to sources. Tag every customer with how they found you. Track customer lifetime value by acquisition source—not just first purchase. Connect invoices to original lead source. Attribute repeat purchases to the original channel. You'll find some channels have much higher lifetime value than others.

slides.title: Step 4: Calculate ROI
slides.narration: Calculate ROI with a simple formula: Revenue minus Cost, divided by Cost, times one hundred. Example: Facebook Ads cost five hundred dollars and generated two thousand in revenue. ROI is three hundred percent. Below one hundred percent means losing money. One to two hundred is modest. Above two hundred percent—scale that channel. Compare channels monthly and shift budget to winners.

slides.title: Pro Tips

tips: Include customer lifetime value, not just first purchase
Track assisted conversions (channels that help but don't close)

slides.narration: ROI tracking pro tips. Give channels ninety days before judging—some have longer sales cycles. Include customer lifetime value, not just first purchase—email subscribers might buy repeatedly. Track assisted conversions—channels that help the sale even if they don't close it. Review ROI monthly, adjust spending quarterly.

slides.title: Start Tracking ROI
slides.narration: Ready to know what's actually working? Set up ROI tracking now. Or see the ROI dashboard first to know what insights you'll get. Stop guessing—start knowing.
